title: Data Scientist II, Tissue Engineering
location: New York, New York, United States
description:
About Us 
Valo Health is a technology company that is integrating human-centric data and AI-powered technology to accelerate the creation of life-changing drugs for more patients faster. Valo was created with the belief that the drug discovery and development process can and should be faster and less expensive, with a much higher probability of success. We are using models early to fail less often, executing clinical trials to add valuation to the company, and generating fit-for-purpose data to feed back into Valo’s Opal Computational Platform™ as we reinvent drug discovery and development from the ground up. Disease doesn’t wait, so neither can we.   
We are a multi-disciplinary team of experts in science, technology, and pharmaceuticals united in our mission to achieve better drugs for patients faster. Valo is committed to hiring diverse talent, prioritizing growth and development, fostering an inclusive environment, and creating opportunities to bring together a group of different experiences, backgrounds, and voices to work together. We achieve the widest ranging impact when we leverage our broad backgrounds and perspectives to accelerate a new frontier in health. Valo seeks to become the catalyst for the pharmaceutical industry and drive the digital transformation of the industry. Are you ready to join us?   
About the Role 
Join a growing (in vitro modelling) team as a central node connecting our efforts in data science, tissue engineering, and drug discovery. As a Data Scientist you will use your skills and experience to advance the engineering of human tissue models, focusing on cardiac and skeletal muscle models. 
You will be part of a team responsible for developing and building computational models, engineered tissue assays, statistical models, computer vision software, and other machine learning based tools for use throughout our drug discovery pipeline. 
Successful candidates will work with a diverse set of scientists, engineers, and domain experts in ways that cut across traditional industry boundaries, building powerful computational tools to advance the discovery and development of new medicines. 
What You'll Do...

Data capture and processing 


Data pipelines, meta-data capture and provenance 


Imaging and time series data processing 


Data Exploration and Analysis 


Collaborate with biologists and computational scientists to visualize, preprocess, and analyze large datasets related to human tissue models and bioengineering experiments 


Create clear and informative data visualizations and statistical summaries to communicate findings to technical and non-technical colleagues 


Implement robust validation procedures to ensure reliability and accuracy of tissue engineering and biological model data 


Experimental Design 


Asist in planning experiments, ensuring data collection is optimized for downstream statistical and analytical purposes 


Machine Learning and Modeling 


Develop predictive models and algorithms to identify factors impacting the development, manufacturing and use of tissue models 


Optimize experimental conditions and understand complex biological systems in pursuit of optimal drug candidates 


Model in-vitro phenotypic responses to chemical and genetic perturbations 

 
What You Bring...

A Ph.D., Master’s degree +2-3 years’ experience, or BS +3-4 years’ experience, in a relevant computational science field (e.g., computational biology, bioengineering, biostatistics). 


Strong programming skills in Python and proficiency with data analysis libraries database management, as well as versioning of code, data, and models, with additional skills in SQL preferred 


Strong background in data analysis and statistics 


Experience with computer vision and machine learning techniques and tools, such as neural networks, generative models, regression, ensemble learning, regularization, and classification 


Strong familiarity with bioengineering principles and human tissue models preferred. 


Familiarity with cardiovascular/metabolic/renal/immune systems in the context of computational biology also preferred 


Excellent problem-solving and critical thinking abilities 


Strong communication skills for effective collaboration and results presentation 


Familiarity with Data and DS best practices; data platforms (data bricks, snowflake); cloud environments (AWS, GCP) 

More on Valo 
Valo Health, LLC (“Valo”) is a technology company built to transform the drug discovery and development process using human-centric data and artificial intelligence-driven computation. As a digitally native company, Valo aims to fully integrate human-centric data across the entire drug development life cycle into a single unified architecture, thereby accelerating the discovery and development of life-changing drugs while simultaneously reducing costs, time, and failure rates. The company’s Opal Computational Platform™ is an integrated set of capabilities designed to transform data into valuable insights that may accelerate discoveries and enable Valo to advance a robust pipeline of programs across cardiovascular metabolic renal, oncology, and neurodegenerative diseases. Founded by Flagship Pioneering and headquartered in Lexington, MA, Valo also has offices in New York, NY. To learn more, visit www.valohealth.com.  New York Pay Range$145,000—$160,000 USD

About Us 

Valo Health is a technology company that is integrating human-centric data and AI-powered technology to accelerate the creation of life-changing drugs for more patients faster. Valo was created with the belief that the drug discovery and development process can and should be faster and less expensive, with a much higher probability of success. We are using models early to fail less often, executing clinical trials to add valuation to the company, and generating fit-for-purpose data to feed back into Valo’s Opal Computational Platform™ as we reinvent drug discovery and development from the ground up. Disease doesn’t wait, so neither can we.   

We are a multi-disciplinary team of experts in science, technology, and pharmaceuticals united in our mission to achieve better drugs for patients faster. Valo is committed to hiring diverse talent, prioritizing growth and development, fostering an inclusive environment, and creating opportunities to bring together a group of different experiences, backgrounds, and voices to work together. We achieve the widest ranging impact when we leverage our broad backgrounds and perspectives to accelerate a new frontier in health. Valo seeks to become the catalyst for the pharmaceutical industry and drive the digital transformation of the industry. Are you ready to join us?   

About the Role 

Join a growing (in vitro modelling) team as a central node connecting our efforts in data science, tissue engineering, and drug discovery. As a Data Scientist you will use your skills and experience to advance the engineering of human tissue models, focusing on cardiac and skeletal muscle models. 

You will be part of a team responsible for developing and building computational models, engineered tissue assays, statistical models, computer vision software, and other machine learning based tools for use throughout our drug discovery pipeline. 

Successful candidates will work with a diverse set of scientists, engineers, and domain experts in ways that cut across traditional industry boundaries, building powerful computational tools to advance the discovery and development of new medicines. 

What You'll Do...

  • Data capture and processing 
  • Data pipelines, meta-data capture and provenance 
  • Imaging and time series data processing 
  • Data Exploration and Analysis 
  • Collaborate with biologists and computational scientists to visualize, preprocess, and analyze large datasets related to human tissue models and bioengineering experiments 
  • Create clear and informative data visualizations and statistical summaries to communicate findings to technical and non-technical colleagues 
  • Implement robust validation procedures to ensure reliability and accuracy of tissue engineering and biological model data 
  • Experimental Design 
  • Asist in planning experiments, ensuring data collection is optimized for downstream statistical and analytical purposes 
  • Machine Learning and Modeling 
  • Develop predictive models and algorithms to identify factors impacting the development, manufacturing and use of tissue models 
  • Optimize experimental conditions and understand complex biological systems in pursuit of optimal drug candidates 
  • Model in-vitro phenotypic responses to chemical and genetic perturbations 

 

What You Bring...

  • A Ph.D., Master’s degree +2-3 years’ experience, or BS +3-4 years’ experience, in a relevant computational science field (e.g., computational biology, bioengineering, biostatistics). 
  • Strong programming skills in Python and proficiency with data analysis libraries database management, as well as versioning of code, data, and models, with additional skills in SQL preferred 
  • Strong background in data analysis and statistics 
  • Experience with computer vision and machine learning techniques and tools, such as neural networks, generative models, regression, ensemble learning, regularization, and classification 
  • Strong familiarity with bioengineering principles and human tissue models preferred. 
  • Familiarity with cardiovascular/metabolic/renal/immune systems in the context of computational biology also preferred 
  • Excellent problem-solving and critical thinking abilities 
  • Strong communication skills for effective collaboration and results presentation 
  • Familiarity with Data and DS best practices; data platforms (data bricks, snowflake); cloud environments (AWS, GCP) 

More on Valo 

Valo Health, LLC (“Valo”) is a technology company built to transform the drug discovery and development process using human-centric data and artificial intelligence-driven computation. As a digitally native company, Valo aims to fully integrate human-centric data across the entire drug development life cycle into a single unified architecture, thereby accelerating the discovery and development of life-changing drugs while simultaneously reducing costs, time, and failure rates. The company’s Opal Computational Platform™ is an integrated set of capabilities designed to transform data into valuable insights that may accelerate discoveries and enable Valo to advance a robust pipeline of programs across cardiovascular metabolic renal, oncology, and neurodegenerative diseases. Founded by Flagship Pioneering and headquartered in Lexington, MA, Valo also has offices in New York, NY. To learn more, visit www.valohealth.com.  

New York Pay Range$145,000—$160,000 USD
